headline: Lamb Favored in Democratic Committee Vote for US Senate
author: Tory Gates

Pennsylvaniaâ€™s Democratic Policy Committee deadlocked on Saturday, over who would gain the endorsement for the US Senate.
Meeting in Harrisburg, Congressman Conor Lamb earned 60% of votes from the nearly 350 members who voted; a two-thirds majority is required to secure the nomination.
Governor John Fetterman, Montgomery County Commissioner Val Arkoosh and Representative Malcolm Kenyatta of Philadelphia are among those seeking the nomination.
The election will fill the seat of departing Republican Senator Pat Toomey.
Lamb, who represents the Pittsburgh area is in his third term.
